sn12.45:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying at Nādika in the brick house.
sn12.45:4.3: Then while the Buddha was in private solitude he spoke this explanation of the teaching:
sn12.45:5.1: “Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
sn12.45:5.2: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:5.3: Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:5.4: Craving is a condition for grasping. …
sn12.45:5.5: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.45:6.1: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. …
sn12.45:6.2: Nose consciousness arises dependent on the nose and smells. …
sn12.45:6.3: Tongue consciousness arises dependent on the tongue and tastes. …
sn12.45:6.4: Body consciousness arises dependent on the body and touches. …
sn12.45:6.5: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and phenomena.
sn12.45:6.6: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:6.7: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.45:6.8: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:6.9: Craving is a condition for grasping. …
sn12.45:6.10: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.45:7.1: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
sn12.45:7.2: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:7.3: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.45:7.4: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:7.5: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn12.45:7.6: When grasping ceases, future existence ceases. …
sn12.45:7.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn12.45:8.1: Ear consciousness arises dependent on the ear and sounds. …
sn12.45:8.2: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and phenomena.
sn12.45:8.3: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn12.45:8.4: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn12.45:8.5: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn12.45:8.6: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn12.45:8.7: When grasping ceases, future existence ceases. …
sn12.45:8.8: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
sn12.45:9.1: Now at that time a certain monk was standing listening in on the Buddha.
sn12.45:9.4: “Monk, did you hear that explanation of the teaching?”
sn12.45:9.6: “You should learn that explanation of the teaching,
sn12.45:9.9: That explanation of the teaching is beneficial and relates to the fundamentals of the spiritual life.”
